item.title: Analysing a Decade of Github Stars
item.description: I assembled and analysed a decade of timestamped Github stars, in order to retrospectively analyse large IT trends. The analysis is based on Github stars. Stars are a rough proxy for popularity, and an even rougher proxy for value, of a repository. Like any proxy measure, it is flawed. But it’s sufficient for a rough trend analysis. An additional caveat is that tech represented on Github is a non-representative subset of IT tech overall.
